description: This event is sent when an alarm has been cleared
either by the system or by an operator. Note that the
currentAlarmIndex is implicitly sent as the instance identifier
for currentAlarmOid. All alarm-specific variables sent in the
alarm notification is also sent in this notifications.
This object may be included in a notification definition for
an event. It specifies the time the event was generated.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::eventTime

description: The SNMP Notification which was sent to represent the alarm.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmOid

description: This alarm is set when an iSD is down and out of service.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::alteonISDDown ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity i 0 ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause s EXAMPLE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP a 192.0.2.1

description: The perceived severity of the fault. A manager can set
this value to clear only. When set to clear, the alarm
is removed from this table, and a 'clearAlarm' event is
generated.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity

description: The time the fault was detected.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime

description: The probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause

description: The IP address of the iSD box
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::isdIP

description: This alarm is sent when there is just a sindle iSD master
left in the system. The fault tolerance level of the system
is severly degraded - if the last master fails, the system
cannot be reconfigured.
This alarm is only set if there are more than two masters
configured in the system.

event.Summary: Only one iSD master left in the system

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::alteonISDSingleMaster ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity i 0 ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause s EXAMPLE

description: The perceived severity of the fault. A manager can set
this value to clear only. When set to clear, the alarm
is removed from this table, and a 'clearAlarm' event is
generated.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity

description: The time the fault was detected.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime

description: The probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause

description: This alarm is set when the iSDs in the cluster have different
licenses.

event.Summary: iSDs in the cluster have different licenses

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::alteonISDLicense ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity i 0 ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause s EXAMPLE

description: The perceived severity of the fault. A manager can set
this value to clear only. When set to clear, the alarm
is removed from this table, and a 'clearAlarm' event is
generated.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmSeverity

description: The time the fault was detected.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmTime

description: The probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: ALTEON-ISD-PLATFORM-MIB::currentAlarmCause
